page.title: 08CHARTER HOUSE
page.content: {Charter House}is an old people's home in Kimbolton Road. It has 60 residents; the oldest is 96, the youngest is 60. We went there to find out what Bedford used to be like and what they think of it now. Some said that Bedford was too modern, another thought that it was spoilt because it used to be more like the countryside. Now it is a busy town. When they were young their toys inculded prams, dolls and cots. Their hobbies were tatting, music knitting, and playing Bridge. Their hobbies now are reading and doing crosswords. When they were young some had to do the household chores, like dusting, others had servants. Landmarks then were the John Bunyan and John Howard statues. Most like living in {Charter {House}.
